intro: Verbascum simavicum, commonly known as the Simavicum mullein, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are broad and fuzzy, which help reduce water loss, a key adaptation for its arid habitat. Verbascum simavicum is often found in mountainous regions, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soils.
